TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509SecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon an X.509 certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To get the details of the X.509 certificate, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the X.509 certificate. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified X.509 certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Id%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, string id) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the X.509 certificate. Sets the property.
A unique identifier of the security token. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified X.509 certificate and unique identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause<T> () where T : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause;
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause<(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause) T>() cil managed

Docs.typeparam: A that specifies the key identifier to create.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier.
Docs.returns: when is of type , , , or ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The key identifier for an X.509 certificate can be expressed using many different key identifier clauses. These key identifier clauses are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> classes.

Docs.summary: Gets the X.509 certificate associated with the security token.
Docs.value: An that contains the X.509 certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property to get the details about the X.509 certificate associated with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token. For instance, the thumbprint of the X.509 certificate can be accessed using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.Thumbprint%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override T CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T> () where T : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause;
.method public hidebysig virtual instance !!T CreateKeyIdentifierClause<(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause) T>() cil managed

Docs.typeparam: A that specifies the key identifier to create.
Docs.summary: Creates the specified key identifier clause.
Docs.returns: A that is a key identifier clause for the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method is one of the key identifier clause types that an X.509 certificate key identifier can be expressed in. The possible return types are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken>. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> in an unusable state. After calling the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> was occupying.
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
Docs.value: A unique identifier of the security token.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause skiClause) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.
Docs.returns: if is one of the , , , or types and the key identifier clauses match; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.MatchesKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method matches criteria in the X.509 certificate in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property based on the type of the `keyIdentifierClause` parameter. The following table details what is matched.
|Key identifier clause type|What is matched| |--------------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>|The value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.IssuerName%2A> property and the issuer serial number returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetSerialNumber%2A> method.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>|The data returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetRawCertData%2A> method.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>|The subject key identifier extension in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.Extensions%2A> property is matched.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>|The thumbprint that is returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetCertHash%2A> method.|

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Docs.value: A of type that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property to set the cryptographic keys for this security token to protect a SOAP message. The keys can be used, among other things, to digitally sign or encrypt SOAP messages.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ThrowIfDisposed() cil managed

Docs.summary: Throws an exception if the method has been called for this instance.
Docs.exception: the method has been called for this instance.

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and is the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.NotBefore%2A> property of the X.509 certificate specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and is the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.NotAfter%2A> property of the X.509 certificate specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
